title.rendered: Abrams for Governor Statement on Debate Challenge from Dr. Kandiss Taylor

content.rendered:
ATLANTA – Today, the Abrams for Governor campaign responded to the campaign of Dr. Kandiss Taylor, who challenged Stacey Abrams to a debate later this month. Abrams campaign manager Lauren Groh-Wargo issued the following statement:

“It’s up to Brian Kemp and David Perdue to explain to Republican women and to all Georgians why they are excluding Kandiss Taylor from participating in multiple Republican primary debates. We commend Kandiss Taylor for being willing to debate Stacey Abrams, unlike Brian Kemp who in 2018 used a rally with his former supporter Donald Trump to avoid being out-debated by Stacey for a second time. We look forward to debating Kandiss Taylor, David Perdue, or Brian Kemp — whoever wins the Republican primary.”

Fox News reported that Kandiss Taylor will be excluded from two of the three Republican primary debates.

Kemp canceled his second of two debates in 2018 after non-partisan analysis that he had lost the first debate. In this election, Trump endorsed David Perdue, and refers to Kemp as Georgia’s “RINO governor Brian Kemp, who’s been a complete disaster.”

###
